Server.Connection

Class AbstractConnectionFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • Server.Connection.AbstractConnectionFactory

  • public abstract class AbstractConnectionFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    The AbstractConnectionFactory is an abstract class that must be subclassed when one want to use a subclass of ConnectionToClient class. The role of this class is to create these connections when required. The creation of such factory is however optional.

    A factory and the corresponding client connections should be defined when one to handle the received messages inside each ConnectionToClient instances instead of having a centralized handling through the AbstractServer.handleMessageFromClient() method. Project Name: OCSF (Object Client-Server Framework)

    Version:
    August 2003 (2.3)
    Author:
    Dr Robert Laganière, Dr Timothy C. Lethbridge, François Bélanger, Paul Holden
    See Also:
    schedule_project.lloseng.ocsf.server.AbstractServer, schedule_project.lloseng.ocsf.server.ConnectionToClient

    • Method Detail

      • createConnection

        protected abstract ConnectionToClient createConnection(java.lang.ThreadGroup group,
                                                       java.net.Socket clientSocket,
                                                       AbstractServer server)
                                                throws java.io.IOException
        Hook method called each time a new client connection must be created. This method should simply call the constructor of the defined subclass of ConnectionToClient and return the created instance.
        Parameters:
        group - the thread group that contains the connections.
        clientSocket - contains the client's socket.
        server - a reference to the server that created this instance.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occur when creating the connection.
